result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:30 AM  CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: B Harris, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Aaron A. Nelson, DF: Paul William Marshall appeared.  Court reviews file.  Atty Nelson states case is not resolved, waiting on autopsy reports.  ADA Ellenwood makes statements and believes this will go to JT.  Atty Nelson believes scheduling a scheduling conference would make most sense.  Defense Co counselor approved to appear via zoom. Both parties to have witness calendars available for next hearing.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 11:37 AM. bph  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on June 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson   DF:  Paul William Marshall appeared. Case called at 10:19 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status conference. Atty Nelson states matter is not resolved. Still waiting for additional information. Has made requests with medical examiner for tissue slides. Those requests have been denied. Will prepare a motion and order to comply with subpoena. ADA Becker has information for ADA Ellenwood. Forensic autopsy has not yet been completed. Can not speak to the slides. Court requesting Attorney's work together with the slide issues with the medical examiner office. If needs further assistance, file request with the Court. Will schedule for another status. Atty Nelson will have co-counsel on this matter. No notice of retainer has been filed as of yet. Court schedules for status. ADA Ellenwood is now present. Given update on status of autopsy. Will follow up. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Court adjourned at 10:28 a.m.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

22SW65 executed on 2/18/2022. Search Warrant, Application and Affidavit signed by RMW on 2/18/2022. Motion and Order to Seal, as directed in the Findings and Orders of the Search Warrant. Signed by RMW on 2/18/2022. Filed in 22CF99. olg
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 10:15 am.

**AMENDED* 

- Bond on file
-Comply with CHIPS order and any other Court order regarding contact with minors

- Surrender passport to the Clerk of Courts Office within 48 hours of release

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sarah M.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

- No communication about their testimony in the case. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

03:35 PM  CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel.  ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson   DF:  Paul William Marshall appeared. Atty Nelson has received Information. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Atty Nelson asks for 30 days to file Motions as to bindover / charges. Atty Nelson would like to address the N/C on the bond. State takes no position on the N/C. Court responds and modifies bond to NAC. Court confirms address of DE. Bond continues. Adjourned: 3:41 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Filed by DA Anderson. km
Arraignment on March 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle. DA:  Karl E Anderson   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson   DF:  Paul William Marshall appeared. Case called at 2:10 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a preliminary hearing. DA Anderson calls Detective Larson to the Stand. S/T Robert Larson. Employed with the City of Hudson Police Department. Direct by DA Anderson. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Nelson. Witness excused. No further evidence. No argument by either party. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court schedules for arraignment. Court notes a motion to modify bond was filed. Atty Nelson requesting to eliminate the no contact condition. Gives argument. DA Anderson objects to bond modification at this time. Rebuttal by Atty Nelson. Victim would like the Court to refer to the written statement that was submitted. Court at this time will continue the no contact order. Atty Nelson requesting an earlier date for arraignment. Court schedules for arraignment and bond will be reviewed at that time. Address confirmed.  Court adjourned at 3:26 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 011432,
Payable Number: 238060,
Receipt Number: 22R 002327,
Amount: $20.00
Preliminary hearing on March 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

- Comply with CHIPS order and any other Court order regarding contact with minors

- Surrender passport to the Clerk of Courts Office within 48 hours of release

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Sarah M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Erica Ellenwood. DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson   DF:  Paul Marshall appeared from jail by video means. Case called at 1:06 p.m. DE has a copy of complaint. Aware of charges and penalties. Waives further reading. Address and DOB confirmed. Atty Nelson argues bond. Court QUASHES WARRANT and schedules for preliminary hearing. Atty Nelson waives time limits to preliminary hearing. Court adjourned at 1:22 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
